newsitem.title: USA: ComEd Quad Cities, Ill. nuke reduces power.
newsitem.headline: ComEd Quad Cities, Ill. nuke reduces power.

text.p: Commonwealth Edison Co's 789 megawatt Quad Cities nuclear power unit 2 reduced electrical production to about 35 percent of capacity Wednesday for repairs, a Nuclear Regulatory Commission (NRC) spokesman said.
The Cordova, Ill. unit was reduced for work on a turbine control system, and would not be completely shut down, the NRC spokesman said Wednesday.
Company officials were not immediately available for comment.
Quad Cities unit 1, also with a capacity of 789 megawatts, continued to produce normally at 100 percent of capacity, the NRC spokesman said.
Commonwealth Edison is a subsidiary of Unicom Corp.
